definition: generic term for birds and animals/birds/to capture (old)
birds and animals/the beasts of the field and the birds of the air

sentences.english: Its movements imitated the motion of five kinds of birds and beasts.
sentences.chinese: 其招式就模仿了五种飞禽走兽的动作。

sentences.english: Our wisdom can only control the animals but not humans.
sentences.chinese: 人们的智慧能控制飞禽走兽，却无法控制自己。

sentences.english: There is a man-made waterfall in Yu Lang Bird Park.
sentences.chinese: 在裕廊飞禽公园有一个人工瀑布。

sentences.english: At six feet tall, the Eastern Sarus crane is the world’s tallest flying bird.
sentences.chinese: 赤颈鹤足有六英尺高，是世界上身材最高的飞禽。

sentences.english: And where are these disease-resistant birds likely to be found?
sentences.chinese: 那么在哪能找到那些抗病飞禽呢？

sentences.english: And finally, where is the Jurong Bird Park?
sentences.chinese: 最后一题，裕廊飞禽公园在哪里？
试想飞禽走兽如何降生。

sentences.english: I also see that there are so many birds and beats entirely at your feet, right under your beautiful velvet skirt.
sentences.chinese: 我也知道有很多飞禽走兽拜倒在你的天鹅绒裙下。

sentences.english: All the beasts, birds, and fishes of all sizes and shapes were invited.
sentences.chinese: 所有的走兽，飞禽和各种各样的鱼类都接到了邀请。

sentences.english: All birds and animals are living beings.
sentences.chinese: 一切飞禽走兽都是生物。

sentences.english: If a druid shapeshifts into a flying animal, can it be attacked by melee?
sentences.chinese: 德鲁伊能变成飞禽，那么会被近战攻击吗？

definition: birds and animals/the beasts of the field and the birds of the air
Ratitae (formerly Cursores) flightless birds such as ostriches
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
(bird species of China) common pheasant (Phasianus colchicus)
(bird species of China) northern goshawk (Accipiter gentilis)
(bird species of China) golden eagle (Aquila chrysaetos)
vulture/(bird species of China) griffon vulture (Gyps fulvus)
